models.name: users
models.description:
User Accounts - This implements the requirement for account management, authentication, and user platform access described in the requirements (see Functional and Security sections). 

Represents an individual with login ability on the platform. Stores vital authentication and traceable identity details. For example, every participant, moderator, or admin will have an entry here.

Key relationships: Connects to user_profiles for extended information, user_roles for group membership, audit_logs for traceability, posts/threads for authorship. 
Special behaviors: Unique email/username constraints; supports soft deletion and audit trails via timestamps.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each user account.

plainFields.name: email
plainFields.description:
User's email. - Implements communication and login requirements.

Used for authentication and potentially for notifications. For example, serves as username credential. Must be unique.

plainFields.name: username
plainFields.description:
Unique user name. - Implements account uniqueness and user identity requirement.

Used for login or public display. For example, visible on posts and profile. Must be unique in the system.

plainFields.name: password_hash
plainFields.description:
Password hash - Implements password security and authentication requirement.

Stores bcrypt or similar hash of the user password. Never the raw password. Used in login process, not shown to user.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Account creation timestamp - Implements audit trail requirement.

Automatically set at account registration. Used for registration reports, user analytics.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description:
Timestamp of last update to user account - Implements audit/audit log and profile update requirement.

Set anytime key account details change. For audits and profile management.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description:
Soft deletion timestamp - Implements privacy and soft deletion/removal requirement.

Set when account is deactivated, instead of hard delete. Allows possible restoration and audit evidence.

models.name: user_profiles
models.description:
User Profiles - Implements extended profile information per user account, as requested in Functional Requirements under profile management. 

Contains additional user-controlled info like name, bio, avatar, etc. For example, a user's display name, image, and biographical summary.

Key relationships: Required 1:1 link to users; referenced often on UI presentations.
Special behaviors: Enforces 1:1 relationship, nullable fields for optional profile data.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key for each user profile record.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Linked user's {@link users.id}. - Implements 1:1 profile-to-user mapping requirement.

plainFields.name: display_name
plainFields.description:
User's chosen display name - Implements personalization/identity extension.

Used as the public-facing name in posts, may be different than username.

plainFields.name: bio
plainFields.description:
User biography/description - Implements rich profile requirement.

Short description or statement visible on profile.

plainFields.name: avatar_url
plainFields.description:
URL for user's avatar image - Supports profile image requirement.

Stored as external or CDN path, shown with user's posts.

plainFields.name: location
plainFields.description:
User-chosen location - Implements optional demographic context.

May be used for site statistics or personalization, not mandatory.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Profile creation timestamp - For auditing and reporting.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last update to profile data - For modifications, audit trails.

models.name: roles
models.description:
Roles Table - Implements permission group definitions (see User Roles & Permissions requirement).

Defines abstract user roles (admin, moderator, user, etc.) for assigning permissions. For example, 'Moderator' grants editing powers in the forum.

Key relationships: Many-to-many with users via user_roles and with permissions via role_permissions.
Special behaviors: Ensures unique role names; allows for extension of roles over time.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key for each user role.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description:
Role name - Implements RBAC requirement.

E.g., 'Admin', 'Moderator', 'User', must be unique. Used in access control.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description:
Role description - Implements clarity for administrators.

Explains purpose of the role. Used in admin dashboard.

models.name: permissions
models.description:
Permissions Table - Implements fine-grained access control (Functional and Security Requirements).

Represents specific allowed or disallowed actions (e.g., create_post, delete_thread).

Key relationships: Many-to-many with roles via role_permissions.
Special behaviors: Ensures unique permission names.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key for each permission.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description:
Permission name - Implements access control labeling.

E.g., 'create_post', 'ban_user'. Used programmatically.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Permission description - For administrator understanding.

models.name: user_roles
models.description:
User Roles Assignment Table - This implements assignment of users to roles (requirement from Roles and Permissions and User Management).

Represents the many-to-many mapping of users to roles. For example, a user in both 'User' and 'Moderator' roles.

Key relationships: Foreign keys to both users and roles. Junction model for M:N relation.
Special behaviors: Composite unique index for (user_id, role_id) ensures no duplicate assignments.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key for the user_roles assignment.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Assigned user's {@link users.id} - Links to account assigned a role.

foreignFields.name: role_id
foreignFields.description: Assigned role {@link roles.id} - Links to the assigned permission group.

plainFields.name: assigned_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp for when role was assigned - Enables audit and reporting purposes.

models.name: organizations
models.description:
Organizations Table - Supports multi-tenant, group collaboration, or affiliation (Professional/Best-Practice Extension based on extensibility and potential B2B use).

Captures user affiliation to an organization (e.g., university club, political group, company).

Key relationships: Users may belong to one or more organizations, supports future extensibility.
Special behaviors: Ensures unique organization names.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key for organization.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description: Organization name - Unique per org. Used in user affiliation and for content segmentation.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Optional description of organization for clarity, UI presentation, and reporting.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation timestamp for audit/tracing.

models.name: categories
models.description:
Forum category (main topic area) - This implements the requirement for high-level classification of discussion content. 

Categories organize threads and subforums by major topical focus such as 'Politics' or 'Economics' (requirement: 08_content_categorization_search.md). For example, 'Politics' can have multiple subforums for regional issues. 

Key relationships: 1:N with subforums, threads inherit category via subforum.
Special behaviors: Categories are managed by admins, may be merged, hidden, or retired via moderation actions.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for a category.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description:
Display name of the category - Implements topic organization requirement. 

E.g., 'Politics' or 'Economics'. Must be unique within the system.
Required field.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description:
Category description - Implements content clarification for users. 

Provides details about category scope or relevant guidelines. For example, describing what belongs in 'Economics'. Optional field.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Timestamp when the category was created - Implements auditability and chronological sorting. 

Standard system field. Auto-populated.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description:
Timestamp when the category was last updated - Ensures audit history for admins and content managers.
Auto-updated.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description:
Soft delete timestamp for the category - Implements archival/deactivation requirement. 

Category is considered inactive if set; do not hard-delete to preserve content history.

models.name: subforums
models.description:
Subforum section within a category - Implements fine-grained content taxonomy per the requirement for nested topical organization (08_content_categorization_search.md).

Subforums allow for subdivisions of categories (e.g., 'U.S. Politics' within 'Politics'). For example, a thread on 'Elections' might belong to a specific subforum. 

Key relationships: Each subforum belongs to a category (1:N), and contains many threads.
Special behaviors: Subforum order, retire/archive, or merge actions can be handled by admins.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for subforum.

foreignFields.name: category_id
foreignFields.description:
Belonged category's {@link categories.id} - Each subforum is nested under a single category.
Implements the taxonomy hierarchy requirement.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description:
Display name of the subforum - Subdivides category by region or theme (e.g., 'International Relations' under 'Politics').
Required, unique per category.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description: Description of subforum - Clarifies intended focus of this subforum for users and moderators.

plainFields.name: sort_order
plainFields.description: Display order index for subforums within a category - Implements UI/UX requirement for configurable sort sequence. Lower is shown earlier.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the subforum was created - For audit history, reporting, and sort purposes. Required.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the subforum was last updated - For administrative tracking and audit trail. Required.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Soft delete timestamp for subforum - Archives or deactivates without removing history; preserves moderation/audit trail.

models.name: tags
models.description:
Discussion content tag - Implements the tagging requirement for content classification and user-driven search (08_content_categorization_search.md).

Tags help organize threads by subject matter, popular concepts, or community interests (e.g., '#Inflation', '#Elections2024'). Moderators may edit or merge tags. 

Key relationships: Many-to-many with threads (thread_tags junction table, in Threads domain), can be suggested or retired.
Special behaviors: Tag usage statistics, moderation, and suggestion management.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each tag.

plainFields.name: name
plainFields.description:
Unique tag string - Implements tag creation and suggestion.
E.g., '#Economy', case-insensitive match for uniqueness.
Required, unique system-wide.

plainFields.name: description
plainFields.description:
Descriptive text to clarify tag intent - Assists with moderation, disambiguation, and user onboarding.
E.g., distinguishes '#Markets' from similar terms.
Optional.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of tag creation - For moderation review and trending/usage history.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Last updated timestamp - To track moderation and edit history.

plainFields.name: retired_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp if the tag is retired/deprecated - Implements lifecycle control, allowing tags to be removed from suggestions without orphaning old threads.

models.name: threads
models.description:
Thread entity - This implements the section for discussion thread management, mapped from the requirements in Section 4 (Functional Requirements) and 8 (Content Categorization & Search). 

This model represents individual discussion threads within the forum, supporting both political and economic topics. It stores the thread's basic information and moderation status, and links to the user who started the thread, the category, and subforum. For example, when someone creates a new topic about inflation in the Economy section, a record is inserted here.

Key relationships: linked to users (author), categories, subforums, and aggregates posts, tags, and views via thread_tags and thread_views. 
Special behaviors: Soft-deletion for evidence retention, supports pinning/featuring, and moderation flags for locking threads.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each thread. Implements core data model and security recommendations.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description:
Author's user {@link users.id} - Implements the requirements for author attribution and permission management.

Identifies which user created the thread. For example, when a registered user starts a new discussion, this field records the relationship.

foreignFields.name: category_id
foreignFields.description:
Category {@link categories.id} - Implements the requirement for high-level topic segmentation.

Links the thread to its top-level category (e.g., Politics or Economics).

foreignFields.name: subforum_id
foreignFields.description:
Subforum {@link subforums.id} - Implements fine granularity in content organization.

References the specific subforum inside a category. For example, a thread about Tax Policy in the Economics subforum.

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description:
Title of the thread - Implements the main entry point for search and discovery.

Represents the headline or title as entered by the user (e.g., 'Inflation Trends in 2024'). Used in listings, search, and notifications.

plainFields.name: body
plainFields.description:
Content body of the thread - Implements discussion kickoff and initial post content.

Contains the opening statement, question, or reference links. It is the source for moderation and full-text search.

plainFields.name: is_pinned
plainFields.description:
Pinning status - Implements requirement for featured/sticky threads.

Indicates if a thread is pinned to the top of its category or subforum, making it more visible.

plainFields.name: is_locked
plainFields.description:
Lock status - Implements moderation/administration needs.

Prevents further replies or edits when true. For example, a locked thread cannot receive new comments.

plainFields.name: is_deleted
plainFields.description:
Soft delete flag - Implements evidence retention and audit logging.

If true, the thread is hidden from general view but retained for moderation. Allows for reversible deletions and legal record-keeping.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Thread creation time - Implements audit and chronological sorting needs.

Date and time when the thread was originally posted. Used for sorting and time-based queries.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description:
Last update time - Implements content freshness checks and moderation review.

Records when the thread was last edited or modified. Important for tracking post activity and moderation.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description:
Actual deletion time - Implements full retention policies and detailed audit needs.

Stores the timestamp for when deletion occurred, if applicable. Nullable for threads not deleted.

models.name: thread_tags
models.description:
Junction table for threads and tags - This implements the tagging system described in Section 8 (Content Categorization & Search) to support M:N relations between threads and tags.

Links threads with any number of tags for searching and filtering. For example, a thread can be tagged #Inflation, #FiscalPolicy, linking to both the thread and tag entities.

Key relationships: Relates threads to tags. 
Special behaviors: Enforces order of tags via sequence field and ensures a thread can have each tag only once.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for this thread-tag link. Implements audit and relational mapping needs.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged thread's {@link threads.id} - Establishes the linkage for query efficiency and referential integrity.

foreignFields.name: tag_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged tag's {@link tags.id} - Connects a tag to a thread for categorization and search.

plainFields.name: sequence
plainFields.description:
Sequence order - Supports deterministic tag listing or display order.

Stores the order number of tags for a specific thread. Implements UI/display control.

models.name: thread_views
models.description:
Tracking for thread views - Implements analytics for thread popularity, section 4 and 8 reporting, and security/session monitoring (from Section 9). 

Records individual view events (optionally user-identified) to assess the popularity and engagement for each thread. For example, counting how many times a thread on Economic Policy has been viewed by registered users or guests.

Key relationships: Links to threads and optionally to users. 
Special behaviors: Can record multiple view events for analytics, and optionally anonymize user_id for guest visitors (nullable foreign).

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier per view for analytics granularity.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description:
Viewed thread's {@link threads.id} - The thread this view belongs to.

Allows aggregation of view counts per thread.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description:
(Optional) viewer's {@link users.id} - Indicates which user viewed the thread, if authenticated. Nullable for guest/anonymous users.

Implements session/personal analytics and security monitoring.

plainFields.name: viewed_at
plainFields.description:
View event timestamp - Implements tracking of popularity over time.

Indicates when the thread was viewed. Used for time-based analytics and reporting.

plainFields.name: viewer_ip
plainFields.description:
Viewer's IP address - Supports abuse detection, rate limiting, and audit logging.

Stores the IP address of the viewer. Can be used for security/anti-abuse tools.

models.name: posts
models.description:
Discussion Board Post - This implements the requirement for user-generated content from the functional requirements analysis (see 04_functional_requirements.md). 

Represents individual posts within threads in the political & economic discussion forum. A post is authored by a user, belongs to a parent thread (which in turn is linked to categories and subforums), supports edit history for auditability, and can have replies (allowing basic thread nesting). For example, a user initiates a post on economic theory discussions within its relevant thread.

Key relationships: links to the user account (users), thread container (threads), supports tracking via post_edits and post_replies.
Special behaviors: post content is immutable by default; all edits are tracked in post_edits for evidence, supporting the snapshot pattern.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each post.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Author user's {@link users.id} - The user who created this post.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: Parent thread's {@link threads.id} - The thread to which this post belongs.

foreignFields.name: parent_post_id
foreignFields.description:
Optional parent post's {@link posts.id} - If this post is a reply or nested under another post, this field links to the parent. Null for top-level thread posts.

Implements threaded/nested discussion pattern from 04_functional_requirements.md (supports reply structure).

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Content Body - Implements the main user contribution requirement (04_functional_requirements.md). The body of the post. For example, the text the user writes for discussion or reply.

plainFields.name: is_deleted
plainFields.description: Soft Deletion Flag - Implements moderation and content retention requirement, allowing restoration and audit trails (see 07_moderation_community.md). True if post should be hidden from the forum (not actually deleted).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation Timestamp - Required for all Auditing, Sorting, and Moderation workflows. The datetime when the post was created. For example, used to order posts within threads and support activity timelines.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Update Timestamp - Last modification or edit time. Supports chronology for edit history and moderation. Null if never edited.

models.name: post_replies
models.description:
Post Reply Link Table - Implements the threaded/nested replies requirement from 04_functional_requirements.md.

Captures direct reply relationships between posts, allowing the forum to display which post replies to which (one step of the reply hierarchy). This junction model enables efficient query of all replies to a given post, supporting both simple flat and tree reply interfaces. For example: storing that Post B is a reply to Post A.

Key relationships: references both parent and child posts in one-to-many direction (posts table), enabling reply chains.
Special behaviors: Each unique (parent_post_id, child_post_id) pair is enforced; no self-replies allowed.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each reply link.

foreignFields.name: parent_post_id
foreignFields.description: Parent post's {@link posts.id} - The post to which another post is replying.

foreignFields.name: child_post_id
foreignFields.description: Child (reply) post's {@link posts.id} - The post that is replying to the parent.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Creation Timestamp - When the reply was created. Implements timestamp requirement for discussion chronology.

models.name: post_edits
models.description:
Post Edit Snapshot - This implements the audit trail and evidence preservation requirement for edited content (e.g. 07_moderation_community.md, see also snapshot-based architecture in requirements).

Records a complete copy of the post content at the moment of each edit for immutable history, including original, each later edit, and the associated metadata (editor, reason, etc.). For example, if a user edits their post to clarify a point, a new post_edits record is created, referencing the post and containing the entire new content snapshot. This model supports full revert/history/moderation use cases.

Key relationships: links to originating post (posts), the editor (users), and allows reconstruction of the full edit timeline.
Special behaviors: at least one edit record required per post (original version), all later edits are appended in order, preventing tampering or unseen deletions.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each post edit snapshot.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Referenced post's {@link posts.id} - The post being edited.

foreignFields.name: editor_id
foreignFields.description: Editing user's {@link users.id} - The user who performed this edit. May be different from post creator if edited by moderator/admin.

plainFields.name: edit_version
plainFields.description: Edit Version Sequence Number - Implements the versioning/auditability requirement. Starts at 1 for original post, increments for each new edit. Used to reconstruct revision history. For example, 1 (original), 2 (first edit), etc.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Snapshot Content - The text as it existed after this edit. Implements evidence and rollback functionality for moderation.

plainFields.name: edit_reason
plainFields.description: Edit Reason or Message - Short explanation entered by editor (optional). Enhances transparency. For example: 'fixed typo','removed sensitive info'.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Edit Timestamp - When this version of the post was created. Used for ordering and moderation workflows.

models.name: flags
models.description:
[Flags for Reported Content] - This implements the user report/flagging system described in the moderation and reporting tools requirement (see Functional Requirements and Moderation documents).

Allows users to flag threads, posts, or comments for review by moderators. For example, a user may flag a post as inappropriate, spam, or off-topic.

Key relationships: Connected to thread or post being reported, the user who made the report, and moderation review flows.
Special behaviors: Flexible design allows future expansion for flagging other entities. Includes flag status and reason. Only moderators/admins can resolve flags. Ensures audit trails and enables community self-moderation.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each flag/report.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link users.id} who submitted this flag. Implements who reported the content and enables tracking repeated/frequent flaggers or abusers. For example, if user123 flags a post as spam, their ID is recorded here.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: Flagged thread's {@link threads.id}, if a thread is being reported. Supports per-thread moderation and review links. Nullable to support alternative targets (like post flags).

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Flagged post's {@link posts.id}, if a post is being reported. Enables granular moderation. Nullable to support thread-only flags.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Reported reason for flag (e.g., 'Spam', 'Abusive Language', etc.). Implements moderation workflow detail per moderation requirements. Allows moderators to categorize and address the flagged content. For example, a user might select 'harassment' when flagging a comment.

plainFields.name: status
plainFields.description: Current status of the flag (e.g., 'Pending', 'Reviewed', 'Dismissed', 'ActionTaken'). Implements moderation workflow states as standardized in moderation requirements. For example, a new flag starts as 'Pending' and is updated by a moderator as addressed.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when flag was created. Implements the audit trail aspect of moderation requirements. For example, tracks exactly when a thread was reported.

plainFields.name: resolved_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when flag was resolved (content reviewed and moderator took action or dismissed it). Implements moderation/audit requirements. Can be null to indicate unresolved flags.

models.name: moderation_actions
models.description:
[Moderation Actions Log] - This implements moderation event tracking as described in Moderation and Audit Logging requirements.

Stores all actions taken by moderators/admins on reported content. Records the action type, actor, target (thread/post), and the result of the action. For example, if a moderator deletes a post due to a flag, this log entry is created.

Key relationships: Related to moderators (actor), affected threads or posts, and the associated flag (optional).
Special behaviors: Full traceability of moderation for accountability, transparency, and appeals processes. Supports audit trails and dispute management.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique moderation action event.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator or admin's {@link users.id} who performed this action. Implements accountability and traceability. For example, user789 is the moderator who deleted a post.

foreignFields.name: flag_id
foreignFields.description: Associated {@link flags.id}, if the action was triggered due to a specific flag/report. Implements linkage between user flag and moderator action. Nullable to allow direct moderation/administrative actions not originated from a user report.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: Targeted thread's {@link threads.id}, if relevant. Allows action-level granularity (locking, pinning, removing threads). Nullable to allow actions solely on posts or other targets.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Targeted post's {@link posts.id}, if relevant. Supports granularity for content-level actions.

plainFields.name: action_type
plainFields.description: Type of moderation action (e.g., 'Delete', 'Lock', 'Warn', 'Edit', 'Pin', 'Ban'). Implements standardized log types per requirements. For example, when a moderator locks a thread, the type is 'Lock'.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Text reason for why this action was taken (e.g., rule violation, spam, etc.). Implements documentation and transparency standards. For example, 'Post contained personal insults'.

plainFields.name: note
plainFields.description: Internal note for context or details on the action. Implements best practices for moderation documentation. For example, moderator may add context for why a post was edited instead of deleted.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the moderation action occurred. Implements audit trail for all moderation operations. For example, records exactly when a ban was issued.

models.name: bans
models.description:
[User Suspension and Bans] - This implements the banning and suspension requirements under Moderation & Community Management, Roles/Permissions tables.

Tracks which users have been banned or temporarily suspended, by whom, when, and for what reason. Used by the platform to enforce community safety and rules. For example, when a user accumulates repeated policy violations, they can be banned for a defined period.

Key relationships: Linked to banned user, moderator/admin who issued the ban, with optional relation to an originating flag. Supports both permanent and temporary bans.
Special behaviors: Enforces permissions on login/posting. Facilitates appeals and ensures traceability.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each ban record.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Banned user's {@link users.id}. Implements tracking of which user is suspended/banned.

foreignFields.name: moderator_id
foreignFields.description: Moderator's {@link users.id} who issued the ban. Supports traceability and accountability of ban decisions. For example, which moderator took this action.

foreignFields.name: flag_id
foreignFields.description: Linked to user report/flag's {@link flags.id} if the ban resulted from a user report. Implements audit and appeals linkage. Nullable if ban was manually or proactively issued.

plainFields.name: reason
plainFields.description: Reason for the ban or suspension (e.g., repeated rule violation, harassment). Implements policy-tracing for ban decisions as outlined in moderation requirements.

plainFields.name: ban_type
plainFields.description: Can be 'Temporary' or 'Permanent'. Implements standard ban types and supports time-based restriction, as per requirements. For example, a user may be suspended for 7 days (temporary) or indefinitely (permanent).

plainFields.name: ban_start
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the ban or suspension starts. Implements required tracking for enforcement periods.

plainFields.name: ban_end
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the ban/suspension ends (nullable for permanent bans). Implements handling of ongoing or indefinite bans.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the ban record was created. Implements audit trail and traceability for all bans issued.

models.name: audit_logs
models.description:
[System Audit Logs for Moderation] - This implements the audit logging, transparency, and accountability requirements in the Moderation section.

Contains unalterable records of key moderation and administration actions for the entire platform. For example, logs of all moderation actions, admin changes, user promotions/demotions, permission updates, thread or post deletions, etc.

Key relationships: Connected to the user (actor), optional thread/post/flag. Can reference other moderation tables.
Special behaviors: Immutable (append-only) log for critical operations. Enables audits, legal compliance, incident response, and rollback investigations.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique audit event identifier.

foreignFields.name: actor_id
foreignFields.description: User's {@link users.id} who performed the logged action. Implements accountability and ties each event to a responsible actor.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description: Related thread's {@link threads.id} if applicable. Implements full event contextualization for audit review.

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description: Related post's {@link posts.id} if applicable. Supports precise audit of content modifications or removals.

foreignFields.name: flag_id
foreignFields.description: Related flag's {@link flags.id} if applicable. Enables correlation between audit log and user reports for appeals and dispute resolution.

plainFields.name: event_type
plainFields.description: Type of the audit event (e.g., 'ModerationAction', 'BanIssued', 'UserRoleChange', 'ThreadDeleted'). Implements detailed event tracking required in moderation, permissions, and transparency requirements.

plainFields.name: summary
plainFields.description: Short summary of event purpose. Implements usability and efficient audit review. For example, 'Post deleted due to guideline violation'.

plainFields.name: details
plainFields.description: Full details or description of event. Implements comprehensive traceability and investigation capability. For example, JSON string describing bulk thread actions or previous state.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the event log was recorded. Implements chrono-traceability for all significant platform changes, as per moderation and admin requirements.

models.name: notifications
models.description:
[User notification entity] - This implements the notifications requirement described in Functional Requirements (section 6: Notifications & Engagement). 

Records individual notifications sent to users for actions including replies, mentions, flagged content, moderation outcomes, or system messages (such as account changes). Provides an auditable and queryable notification trail for all users. For example, creates in-app bell alerts or triggers email notifications when another user replies to a thread, mentions you in a post, or when moderation decisions impact your content.

Key relationships: References {@link users}, {@link threads}, {@link posts}, and optionally {@link moderation_actions} for context. Supports linking to the relevant entity or message. Can expand to support various notification types or channels in the future.
Special behaviors: Marked as read/unread by recipient, optional soft deletion for auditability, supports multiple notification types and optional category-specific payloads.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each notification.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description:
Target user's {@link users.id} - Implements notification delivery requirement. 

Links the notification to the recipient user. For example, if a post is replied to, this field identifies the user who should receive the alert. Not nullable: every notification must belong to a user.

foreignFields.name: thread_id
foreignFields.description:
Optional related thread's {@link threads.id} - Implements contextual linking for thread notifications. 

If provided, gives contextâ€”e.g., notification relates to activity on this thread. Nullable: not all notifications are tied to a thread (e.g., site-wide alerts).

foreignFields.name: post_id
foreignFields.description:
Optional related post's {@link posts.id} - Implements contextual linking for post notifications. 

Contextualizes notifications to a specific post (such as replies, mentions, or flagged posts). Nullable.

foreignFields.name: moderation_action_id
foreignFields.description:
Optional moderation action's {@link moderation_actions.id} - Implements moderation notification requirements.

Relates to the moderation event that triggered the notification, e.g., user warned or post removed. Nullable: not all notifications come from moderation actions.

plainFields.name: type
plainFields.description:
Type of notification - Implements notification category requirement.

E.g., 'reply', 'mention', 'flag', 'moderator_action', 'system', etc. Used to render and filter notifications appropriately. Required field.

plainFields.name: message
plainFields.description:
Notification message body - Implements descriptive content requirement. 

Text content sent to the recipient, such as 'You have a new reply!' May support markdown or limited HTML for formatting. Required field.

plainFields.name: read
plainFields.description:
Whether notification has been read - Implements user engagement tracking.

For example, when user opens the bell, 'read' is set true. Allows highlighting new/unseen notifications. Required.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Notification creation datetime - Implements consistent auditing/timestamp requirement.

Records when notification event occurred. Required. Used for sorting and recency checks.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description:
Time notification was (soft) deleted - Implements audit and history requirements.

Nullable: Not set unless notification is deleted. Soft deletion preserves history for audits.

models.name: conversations
models.description:
Conversation entity - This implements the private messaging and group chat requirement drawn from the functional requirements and user engagement use-case analysis. 

Business explanation: Represents a one-on-one or group chat context where users can exchange messages privately, outside of public threads. For example, a conversation could be a private discussion between two users or a group chat among several moderators.

Key relationships: Tied to users (participants). Participants and membership are often modeled via related user-conversation junction tables (referenced as part of user_settings or future expansion). All messages within a conversation reference this conversation.
Special behaviors: Only participants can access the conversation. Can be extended to support group chats by relating to multiple users.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for the conversation.

plainFields.name: title
plainFields.description: Title of the conversation - Implements group chat usability for easier navigation (requirement: scalable/private messaging). For business meaning: Optional, for group conversations. For example, 'Moderators Private Room'. Can be null for simple 1-on-1 conversations.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the conversation was created - Implements data auditability, for sorting and searching conversation start (requirement: platform maintainability/audit). For example, when a conversation is initiated.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp of the most recent message or update - Supports chronological sorting and notification triggers (requirement: user notification/engagement). For example, updated when a new message is sent.

plainFields.name: is_group
plainFields.description: Whether this is a group conversation - Implements distinction between 1-on-1 and group chats (requirement: group communication expansion). For example, true for 'Moderator Chat', false for direct message.

models.name: messages
models.description:
Message entity - Implements the private messaging requirement as detailed in the platform's core social/user engagement features in the requirements document.

Business explanation: Represents an individual message sent within a conversation. For example, a user sending 'Hey, are you free to discuss moderation policies?' to another user.

Key relationships: Each message references the conversation it belongs to and the sending user. Messages are strictly ordered and can be soft-deleted or edited for auditability/security per audit trail requirement.
Special behaviors: Only participants in the conversation can view messages. Supports features like edit history or deletion tracking via additional flags/fields if needed.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for each message.

foreignFields.name: conversation_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged conversation's {@link conversations.id} - Links the message to its parent conversation (requirement: message-threading, access control). For business meaning: Only messages within this conversation are retrieved when loading chat history.

foreignFields.name: sender_id
foreignFields.description: Sender user's {@link users.id} - Links to the user who authored this message (requirement: accountability, notification routing). For example, user who typed and sent the message.

plainFields.name: content
plainFields.description: Body/content of the message - Implements the actual communication (requirement: core platform function). For example, the text 'Hello, how are you?'. Not nullable, cannot be empty string in enforcement layer.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when this message was sent - Implements audit trail and message ordering (requirement: accountability, search). For example, used in conversation timelines.

plainFields.name: edited_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the message was edited (if applicable) - Enables edit history and transparency (requirement: content integrity/audit). For example, updated if user edits their message. Can be null if never edited.

plainFields.name: deleted_at
plainFields.description: Timestamp when the message was deleted (if applicable) - Allows for soft deletion for audit trails (requirement: privacy/compliance). For example, set if message is deleted but retained for moderation.

models.name: user_settings
models.description:
User-specific platform, privacy, and notification preferences - This implements the requirement to allow users to manage their forum experience and privacy. 

Enables per-user settings like notification preferences, language, privacy toggles, and custom UI options (if available). For example, users may choose to receive email notifications, restrict profile visibility, or alter interface appearance.

Key relationships: Required 1:1 link to the users table; references user account that these settings apply to.
Special behaviors: Enforces 1:1 relationship with users (each user can have only one settings row); per-field option expandability for future needs.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for the user_settings row.

foreignFields.name: user_id
foreignFields.description: Belonged user's {@link users.id} - The forum user account this settings row is attached to.

plainFields.name: email_notifications
plainFields.description:
Email notifications toggle - Implements user communication preference requirement.

If true, the user receives email notifications about replies, mentions, or other events. Example: 'Send me an email for each new reply.' Default: true.

plainFields.name: privacy_profile_visible
plainFields.description:
Profile visibility option - Implements user privacy management requirement.

If false, the user's profile is hidden from public/user listings. Example: 'Hide my profile from other users.' Default: true (visible).

plainFields.name: language
plainFields.description:
Preferred user language - Implements internationalization/usability features.

Stores user-selected locale (e.g., 'en', 'ko', 'es'). Example: User sets UI display to Korean. Nullable for default forum language.

plainFields.name: theme
plainFields.description:
UI theme preference - Implements accessibility/usability expansion.

User's chosen UI color theme (e.g., 'light', 'dark'). Adds personalization/UX flexibility. Nullable for default.

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Creation timestamp - Implements system data audit requirements.

Time the settings row was initially created. For example, used in audit logs or rollback, never null.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description:
Last updated timestamp - Implements system audit and data currency.

Tracks when settings were last changed.

models.name: site_settings
models.description:
Singleton platform-wide configuration - This implements the administrative requirements for global configuration and community governance defined in the platform setup. 

Stores forum-wide or system-critical configuration (e.g., site name, legal policies, registration settings, spam protection, allowed file types). For example, used by administrators to update system name, enable/disable new registration, or set featured announcement.

Key relationships: No foreign relations; only a single row allowed.
Special behaviors: Enforced singleton pattern (only one row). Expansion via new columns for additional settings. Modifications restricted to administrators.

primaryField.name: id
primaryField.description: Primary Key. Unique identifier for the singleton site_settings row.

plainFields.name: site_name
plainFields.description:
Forum/site display title - Implements branding requirement from admin needs.

Shown in headers, emails, and may influence SEO. For example, 'EconoPolis Community'.

plainFields.name: registration_open
plainFields.description:
New user registration toggle - Implements administrative control requirement.

If false, new public account signups are disabled (e.g., maintenance, invite-only phase). For example, used to temporarily close registration due to spam wave. Default: true (open).

plainFields.name: default_language
plainFields.description:
Default forum language - Implements internationalization/usability requirement.

Locale code for unauthenticated visitors or accounts with unset language. For example: 'en' or 'ko'.

plainFields.name: legal_policy_url
plainFields.description:
Legal policy link - Implements requirement for privacy/GDPR compliance.

URL pointing to the forum's terms of service/privacy policy.

plainFields.name: allowed_file_types
plainFields.description:
Accepted file types for uploads - Implements admin content safety policy requirement.

Comma-separated string of allowed file extensions or MIME types (e.g., 'jpg,png,gif,mp3,mp4,pdf'). Nullable for default support.

plainFields.name: spam_protection_enabled
plainFields.description:
Enables system-wide anti-spam features - Implements professional recommendation for forum security and anti-abuse.

If true, rate limiting, CAPTCHA, keyword filters, etc. are active. For example, 'true' during heavy spam attacks. Default: true (enabled).

plainFields.name: created_at
plainFields.description:
Creation time of the site_settings row - Implements system audit requirements/spatial expansion.

Set on initial platform setup. Never null.

plainFields.name: updated_at
plainFields.description:
Last update time - Implements audit/history requirements.

Updated when admin changes to site settings are made. Never null.
